channel.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
channel.description:
Recently the moparisthebest.com/smf forums have had little activity in posts. I have a theory that this is down to a few things, so I have made a list of the problems and hopefully staff will resolve these issues. [ul][li]People join this forum for support, although they don't get any from other members. All they get is abuse, therefore they are leaving to other communities.[/li] [li]Moparscape doesn't offer the best range of achievements and goals, by this I mean only a few members are trying to bring something new out to the public and something they will enjoy.[/li] [li]Moparscape's client is out dated, yet I am aware they are making a new client shortly.[/li] [li]The forums need a good touch, personally I like the default SMF theme but surely there is a nicer theme out there.[/li] [li]Staff aren't like they used to be (I am not going to talk about this, some old member possibly know what I'm on about).[/li][/ul] As stated before, hopefully staff will resolve this problem because the post count has seemed to go down. [b]Recent activity:[/b] [i]November 2009[/i]
[b]New topics, New posts, New members, Most online.[/b] 2009-11-01 189 1478 345 327 2009-11-02 139 1114 197 209 2009-11-03 129 1176 225 219 2009-11-04 111 823 248 222 2009-11-05 103 942 227 207 2009-11-06 141 1241 264 241 2009-11-07 169 1499 322 284 2009-11-08 190 1611 271 271 2009-11-09 135 943 207 218 2009-11-10 144 1174 197 206 2009-11-11 8 109 32 104
[i]October 2009[/i]
[b]New topics, New posts, New members, Most online.[/b] 2009-10-01 121 1246 221 211 2009-10-02 153 1268 246 259 2009-10-03 230 1515 380 329 2009-10-04 189 1489 300 282 2009-10-05 108 818 229 203 2009-10-06 162 1088 174 201 2009-10-07 156 1201 255 216 2009-10-08 144 1179 197 211 2009-10-09 151 1084 257 254 2009-10-10 249 1751 373 289 2009-10-11 233 1879 296 286 2009-10-12 139 1381 235 268 2009-10-13 177 1332 210 215 2009-10-14 133 1192 227 229 2009-10-15 160 1065 214 220 2009-10-16 141 1219 263 247 2009-10-17 201 1224 367 267 2009-10-18 145 986 236 318 2009-10-19 126 916 230 219 2009-10-20 134 1073 221 217 2009-10-21 140 968 216 226 2009-10-22 167 1157 220 246 2009-10-23 120 921 270 266 2009-10-24 170 1083 350 286 2009-10-25 211 1277 351 288 2009-10-26 168 1214 246 243 2009-10-27 124 1071 237 249 2009-10-28 151 1221 215 249 2009-10-29 163 1021 211 243 2009-10-30 36 338 52 168 2009-10-31 159 1135 288 269
Bare in mind, two forums are linked to the same database prefix, therefore most of these posts have been made on moparisthebest.org/smf. Thanks.

item.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Why does any of this shit matter? Why does it really matter if the community is dying? (if it is.) Why does it matter about how the staff talks to other members? The thing is, don’t be fucking stupid and break the rules, then you won’t have the moderators tearing you a new asshole. Read the fucking rules if you’re going to be a part of this community. Don’t purposely piss people off by breaking the rules. And don’t get pissed when the staff gets really pissed off at you and swears at you. It’s nothing personal against you when they do it, (unless they know you or something) it’s simply everybody combined that’s fucking stupid in this community. That’s why the staff gets so pissed at everyone. You know that acceptance page where you have to type ‘yes’ to enter the forums where it shows you all of the information you should know? When was the last time that page was actually put into effect and used? Like the first month prior to launching these forums?

Whatever. The reason I made this post was because I was reading what relmitos was putting and I got a little heated that he can’t really show empathy for the staff members.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)

item.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:45, topic:313683"][quote author=casey. link=topic=410188.msg3029342#msg3029342 date=1258247761]
As Emerson once said, “Envy is ignorance.”
[/quote]

As i once said, “Fuck off”

I’m sure a large percent of the community is sick of you and all the bullshit and annoyance you bestow upon us.[/quote]

Oh I enjoy an ironic post from time to time. Let’s see, bullshit and annoyance. Well, the second one is easy. Your post completely derailed this topic, quite a large annoyance for me. Oh yeah, and your post is full of bullshit. Before you go and attack other members, maybe you should look in a mirror first.

Famous American author Nathanial Hawthorne once said “No man, for any considerable period, can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be true.” He is of course speaking of hypocrisy. I think you should take heed to that warning and start speaking with a little more finesse.

@OP: Forgive me for this off-topic reply. I’ll be sure to keep everyone on-topic hereafter.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)

item.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

The more people find out about RuneScape the more people people will find out about this place.

The life cycle:
Someone discovers RuneScape plays it for a while and then cant be stuffed training. They search “RuneScape cheats” on google. They find a link and click it. It says stuff about RuneScape Private Servers, so they go to Google answers and asks what RuneScape Private Servers are and how to start. Now usually people would be pointed here because its one of the oldest forums

[size=9px]This is when i asked about advertisment banners[/size]

[quote=“Taharok”]The neat thing about this community is that it was the replacement to Kaitnieks. Kait was the only RS hacking community out there. All of those people came over this community, making this one the primary hacking community. After MoparScape was created, we also had the only site with only RSPS-related boards.

So anyway, I’ll get to my point. Since we are so old, everyone knows about this site. Any person in the RS hacking scene knows about Moparisthebest, and every person in the RSPS scene knows MoparScape. Outward advertising would be somewhat a waste of money, and impractical. We might be able to get a few new members, but it’d hardly be worth the advertisement.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

It’s unlike me to start an argument, hah, oops.

Yes, relmitos, you may be older and much more mature than a lot of the guys here at MoparScape, but am I right in saying you’ve only been here since may?

Some of the guys you’re talking to are respected members of the community, and probably know how things work around here better than you do.

Yes, I admit, I was a little… harsh on that guy.
But you don’t fully understand the circumstances.

That guy was here plainly to annoy people, break the rules, and generally be an inconsiderate twat.

Why should I tolerate that behaviour? He didn’t want to be here, he didn’t want to advance the community in any way, he was just trying to make our jobs even harder than they already are.

As said previously, we are not robots, we are not bots programmed to follow the guidelines and rules perfectly, we have lives, why should I waste my time dealing with guys like him just coming onto the forum to deliberately infuriate people?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:28, topic:313683”]The one thing that bothers me the most is that you publicly disgrace and disrespect members.

Instead of calling him a fucktard, or replying like this:

[quote]
“Seriously, leave.”
“Try not gravedigging fucktard.”
“Get the fuck out.”
“Go away.”[/quote]

You could have send him a private message. Tell him what he did wrong. Why it’s not allowed. And what the consequences are if he/she continues that behaviour.
Locking a topic, and replying with 3 or 4 words might seem like less work to you. But instead actually taking your time to handle it may prove more efficient.

You chose to become a moderator out of your own free will, blablabla. But that does not mean you can handle things like this.

My suggestion to you: Praise in public, discipline in private. Social hygiene works too.[/quote]
You’re an idiot. By posting something as ‘harsh’ as “Try not gravedigging fucktard.” on the thread rather than PM, other members will learn to refrain from doing the same thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Activity (Issues that staff can resolve)
